data.title: Great Food, excellent service!
data.text: Zapien's Salsa Grill is a little hidden from street view, but once you try their food, I guarantee you'll find your way back easily. They have a very authentic menu selection, the salsa and chips are addicting and their servers are great. I had the pork with green sauce (chile verde) and it was delicious! I was told they make a really great menudo, I'll have to try that next time.

data.title: Bolillo French toast!
data.text: Ok so I am not a complete regular but this is definitely one of our families favorite places to come and grab a bite. I love the fact that the tacos come in hand made tortillas, outstanding! the bolillo french toast was the highlight for me, you have to give it a try. Aside from those dishes we have also tried the menudo, albondigas, micheladas (of Course) and nothing has disappointed... The only knock is that the owner is at times a bit rude but if you come here enough you realize it is just his way of being, with that being said this is definitely one of my cities hidden gems, it is tucked away in a very small shopping center behind tacos mexico ( Booooo)

data.title: Eat any where else
data.text: Extremely overpriced mediocre Mexican food, I'd rather eat king taco than have to deal with the people who work at this place

data.title: Great Food
data.text: From breakfast (Menudo, Pozole or the Jack Thomas Omelet) to dinner (Chicharones, Carnitas or a basic combo plate) there's always a good choice

data.title: Decent food, accomodating staff
data.text: Recently met with a large group for a Christmas gathering.   Food was really good, maybe a bit pricey, but certainly good.   What was impressive was the service.  We started with a group of 12, whch quickly grew to more than 20.  They moved tables, served everyone promptly.  If in the area, stop in.

data.title: Decent Food not affordably priced
data.text:
Food is decent been here 3 times in about 4 years. Much better places locally to eat good Mexican Food at a lower price. 
Bean dip with chips are good. For the price they charge they need to put money into their establishment especially the bathroom.

data.title: the best in the southland
data.text: While there are many, many Mexican restaurants in Southern California this place is arguably the best I've experienced. the food is truly authentic with a unique touch. for example, they have a breakfast dish; eggs and chicken enchiladas with mole. their mole cause is the best I've tasted which makes for an excellent breakfast dish. Weekend breakfast features homemade tortillas which are so yummy. I've not had a bad meal here. However it's inside a shopping center and can be easy to miss. We had to circle back on our first visit because we passed it up.

data.title: Great Place To Eat And Socialize!
data.text:
I was staying at a nearby hotel and took a walk in search of breakfast. I spotted this place and decided to give it a try- and am glad I did! 

The manager (possibly the owner) came over to my table and chatted with me- and was very friendly while working with his staff to make sure every guest got what they wanted and needed. 

They brought out some sweet bread, chips, salsa, and chipotle bean dip- which were mindblowingly great!

My main dish was Huevos con Chorizo- and I loved it!

I had a great experience here and being from out of state, I will definitely remember this place next time I'm in the area!

data.title: Best Place for Great Mexican Food
data.text: This is The Spot for Great Mexican Food!! I'm a School Bus Driver and when Me and my friends get off in the morning we go to Salsa for the Breakfast. We Love the Food, Staff and the Coffee!!! A Must Go!!!

data.title: Chips and dip
data.text: Big fan of chips and dip . Had the house salsa , what flavor ! The bean dip with chipotle , very good . Not a big salad eater , but I did order the cilantro Caesar salad . Big full plate , and had pieces of grilled chicken , excellent . My girlfriend ordered the chipotle salad , that was ok to me . Also tried the chicharon dip in green salsa , that was delicious ! Service was good for us and our waitress was super friendly and helpful . Now when I go to a Mexican restaurant and it is packed with Mexicans , that is a good sign ! Am coming back and telling my friends about this place !

data.title: Did Salsa have an off night?
data.text: You know I've been here several times with family and friends and always experienced good service and good food. Especially the hand made tortillas when available. I work for a large corporation close by so will bring clients and co workers here. But one evening unfortunately soured all the previous good experiences. Many of my friends and co workers had just left a funeral service for a dear friends mother passing. We had all decided to come to Salsa Grill to have dinner. I had checked their hours earlier and saw they close at 8pm on a Sunday which i thought was unusual so we made it a point to get there before closing. There were about 12 of us and we all drove into parking lot around 730 I saw all the employees sweeping floors so decided to enter and say I had large group. Their sign still indicated open but young women who I guessed was night manager told us they were closed now. I asked politely weren't they open to 8pm and she said yes but this night they were closed. I said I had fellow workers and friends driving up and would be a large receipts. She looked around workers and said let me call owner. She returned and said sorry they turned off everything in kitchen and cook left. I explained these people are regular customers of yours from a large corporation that does visits quite often. She left again to inquire with someone then again said sorry there closed. It was not 8 pm closing time. I told her if she closes early on Sunday evening they should just post on door or put on website that they are subject to early close. So good food or not this place lost some very good loyal clients. The way the economy is these days you would think a business would curry good will instead of turning away loyal customers. So went across street to Chilis and had a decent meal for 15 people and the waiter was very good and we had such good time the place put no pressure on us even though we stayed past their closing time. The waiters were tipped nicely and the manager was kind and had no issue at all that we passed their closing time. That is customer service people. Salsa Grill I will just drive right past you and go to Chilis or another restaurant whenever I'm in area.

data.title: Flavorful food, reasonably priced!
data.text:
Zapien's is a family run Mexican restaurant with some really tasty food.  There are great combination plates with the traditional items: tacos, carnitas and burritos.  Zapien's is one of the few places that offers mole, chicharones, flautas, taquitos and enchiladas suizas.  Everything is very flavorful and combo plates come with beans and rice, but with true homemade flavor.   The enchiladas suizas are really great although they are made with flour tortillas, not the traditional corn tortillas.  The flautas, chicken or beef, are also made with flour tortillas which really allows you to appreciate the meat filling.  Weekday mornings have super $5 specials and there is quite a variety.   They are now offering a brunch menu and they have freshly made tortillas.  The service is always friendly and attentive.  Prices are reasonable and portions are generous.   You are greeted with lightly seasoned tortilla chips (can't figure out their secret seasoning spice!), salsa and, if you are lucky- killer bean dip!   The interior is two rooms with tables or wooden bench booths.  The walls are decorated with art prints and awards.  The owner's son/chef has worked for organizations such as the Angels baseball team. 
  Found this place because it was on a Best of L.A. List and so went to check it out.  The only down side is the strip-mall location that has a lot of foot-traffic as people go to and from the adjacent cigarette store. Worth checking out but go for breakfast, lunch or early dinner.

data.title: Great Mexican Food in Pico Rivera
data.text:
Owner, Jess, is a nice, no-nonsense host
Staff is friendly & helpful
Loved the chile-dusted chips & chipotle bean dip
Food is delicious is delicious e.g., chile verde
Nice Mexican prints adorn the walls
Located in a small strip mall with a tiny sign
